data.title: Retired
data.text: One of the best flavored burgers I've ever had. Fresh ground beef on Hawaiian rolls...great taste. Delicious dogs as well. Nice variety of burgers and dogs. You pay a little bit more...but worth it. Friendly service.

data.title: Bacon dog
data.text: Hot dogs were delicious however be prepared to pay a little more than you expect to pay for a hot dog. The place is worth what you pay for. It is nice, family friendly, they have big screen TVs, and clean restrooms. Definitely will go back!

data.title: Great dogs
data.text: Love this restaurant. The hot dogs are huge. Buns are good. Love the chili. Build your own great. Every time we've been there the staff was friendly and more than willing to help. Like the Happy Hour. Hope they can hang on until road construction is over. Nice clean restaurant. Recommend this if you like hot dogs. They do serve burgers but we haven't tried them.

data.title: Fancy Dogs
data.text:
Very casual dining. OK staff (neither friendly nor rude).

An interesting selection of burgers and dogs.  Everyone enjoyed their food, although one hot dog isn’t that filling and it did make it a bit expensive to have two.

My salted caramel shake didn’t taste much of caramel.

I would return, to try some of the other offerings.

data.title: Who knew Yuma had such good dogs???
data.text: Boyfriend and I tried this place on the recommendation of a billboard.  See, those things DO work! So, so good.  I had the Reservoir Hog, boyfriend had the Scott Baioli.  And we shared the cheese tater tots.  The guy taking our order was so nice and friendly.  Yuma gets a bad rap sometimes, but this place is worth the stop. My only suggestion - you need better signage. Hopefully when the construction is finished, The Dog Haus gets a bigger sign.

data.title: Yummy fast casual food and brews
data.text: Based on some of the other reviews I'd read, I was surprised that this is a fast casual restaurant. You place your order at the counter and take a number, and they bring out your delicious food in a few short minutes. We came with a party of 10 that included adults, kids, meat-eaters and vegetarians, and EVERYONE was happy. My sister said the Ave Maria veggie burger was the best veggie burger she's ever tasted, and my parents loved their bratwurst with all the fixings. The surprise winner was a sausage that had a maple sriracha and a fried egg on top. Sounded a little weird, but my buddy was in heaven. Coming from San Diego, the beer selection was on the smaller side, but the options were solid. The staff were super fun and friendly.

data.title: Nothing like this in Yuma
data.text: I don't think there is any other restaurant in Yuma like this.  The Hangover is my favorite.  You can pretty much custom your order which is cool because I like tater tots with chili & cheese.  Second time I ate here I couldn't finish my food, its a lot of food.  Good tasting food and very nice concept.

data.title: Hmm it was good
data.text: it was good, more expensive then I liked, people were not the friendliest (had just opened a couple days earlier, maybe they were stressed) I got chili dog and had about a teaspoon of chili on it. Was;t happy when I asked for a little plastic (max 1/4c) cup with some chili in it. I go to our OTHER place for chili dogs. will I go back.. hmm probably not.

data.title: Overdressed, exotic, and not likely to return
data.text: Posh decor for a hot dog and hamburger joint with prices to match. I got a daug and my wife a burger. Neither could be eaten in the "traditional way" holding the bun so be prepared to grab a knife and a fork. The daug tasted like any other dog and the burger was thin on meat and thick on fat. Onion rings were more batter than onion. With some much competition in the fast food space I don't see this concept working long term. There was no "wow" factor like other "upscale" burger places can point to. Once and done.

data.title: Tasty hidden gem
data.text: The Dog Haus in Yuma is a great hidden gem. The prices are affordable, the portions are huge, and the service is quick and friendly. The ordering process can go slow, especially if there is someone who can't decide what they want in front of you. The ambiance of the dining room is pretty cool to boot. Great gathering place for small groups.

data.title: Don't waist you Money
data.text: Tried this place cause it was new. Sorry I did, prices were too high, food was poor, and service left a lot to be desired. Will never go back....

data.title: Mmmm
data.text: This new location was opened not long ago and right on our way home. We typically stop at the one in near Disnsyland but didn't have time to make it our last trip. Thankfully on our way home from San Diego this gem was located. Definitely not healthy food by any means but so yummy.

data.title: Be patient the food is good.
data.text:
They have an excellent selection of house specialties AND you can also build your own dog, bratwurst, sausage, or burger.
Go there around 1-2pm so you miss the rush, if you're an impatient type.

data.title: Where are the toppings?
data.text: I love hot dogs and thought this place would be the ultimate. I was wrong. The dog itself is pretty good and beefy, but where are the toppings. I ordered the "Downtown Dog" and had to look pretty hard for the peppers and onions. The mayo, mustard were there on top but not much else. For the price, I expected more.

data.title: Problems from visit one
data.text: Fun menu with lots of variety.  Very slow ordering service.  Verified order three times and still got it wrong.  Pricey for what you get--family of 4, sharing 2 sides and 2 drinks, more than $40.  Good burgers, smallish for price.

data.title: It was ok
data.text: First off the cashier was very sweet but the rest of the experience was down hill . Food is very over priced at 14 dollars for hot dog, tots and drink !! Did not mind spending the money if the hot dog was over the top good but it was ok . Nothing to write home to mom about . If it was less expensive then I would understand but not at there prices . Also the men there are so unprofessional they are flirting with girls that walk in and there was a line and some girl walked in ordered and didn't have to wait like the rest of us to get her food and the rest of the customers were like what the heck. Right before she left she kissed one of the guys that worked there and walked out with boxes of food . Um didn't know people did not have to wait like the rest of the paying customers that waited 15 mins for there food. Not going there again it's not worth it .
